comments:
Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20060119-0800

Typing was set from right to left after I got the exception below. Meaning inserting a character did not move the caret to the right but moved all character on the right site from the caret one to the right.

See also bug 52015.

The reason for typing backwards is in the replace code of StyledText: it first updates the mode, then sets the caret and selection. Since the replace files in the middle the cart is not set behind what's just being typed in. This give the impression of backward typing.

The cause for the AFE is most likely the Java partitioner which creates overlapping partitions.
Unfortunately the source which caused this is no longer available. We can't do much without a test case.
*** Bug 138039 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
The FastPartitioner's position cache that we introduced gets out of sync by concurrent access to computePartitioning(...).

Fixed in HEAD.
Available in builds > N20060424-0010.

Verified in code that the FastPartitioner's position cache is cleared when it encounters a runtime exception during computePartitioning. This makes the partitioner more stable and reduces the likelyness that it gets out of sync due to multi-threaded access. It does not make corruption impossible, however, as a multi-threaded access can still fill the cache with stale content without causing an exception.
